title: 109_hr599
content: SHORT TITLE AND FINDINGS. The Act is titled the "Federal Lands Restoration, Enhancement, Public Education, and Information Resources Act of 2005." Congress finds that violations of laws and regulations on Federal lands lead to damages requiring restoration activities, and increased public education can help reduce unintentional violations. Fines from violations should be used for restoration efforts. The Act aims to use fines from violations on Federal lands for restoration activities and public education. The Act proposes using fines from violations on Federal lands for restoration and informational activities. The Act suggests using fines from violations on Federal lands for restoration and public awareness activities. The Act proposes using fines from violations on Federal lands for restoration and public awareness activities, with excess funds transferred to the Crime Victims Fund. Amendments to the National Park Service Organic Act include regulations for the use and management of National Park System lands. The Secretary of the Interior may have special management authorities, including lease and permit authorities. Any fines collected for violations of regulations can be used by the Secretary for specific purposes without further appropriation. The Secretary of the Interior can use fines collected for violations of regulations on National Park System lands for improvement, protection, or rehabilitation work, and to increase public awareness of land use rules. Excess funds will be transferred to the Crime Victims Fund. National Wildlife Refuge System lands are also subject to similar provisions. The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 is amended to allow fines collected for violations to be used for improvement, protection, or rehabilitation work on System lands, and to increase public awareness of land use rules. The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 is amended to allow fines collected for violations on System lands to be transferred to the Crime Victims Fund if deemed excess funds. Additionally, the Act of June 4, 1897 is amended regarding surveying public lands. SEC. 551. PROTECTION OF NATIONAL FOREST SYSTEM LANDS; REGULATIONS. Regulations for the use and protection of National Forest System lands are outlined, with penalties for violations specified. Any fines collected as a result of violations will be used by the Secretary of Agriculture for improvement, protection, or rehabilitation work on the lands. The fines collected from violations of regulations on National Forest System lands will be used for improvement, protection, or rehabilitation work on the lands and to increase public awareness of rules. Excess funds will be transferred to the Crime Victims Fund.
